a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: This is the logical model for the Dispense Record entry - the information that can be captured upon the act of dispensing - in a hospital pharmacy, or a community pharmacy. This is not for a future dispense, rather a record of an actual dispense.

definition.value: The logical model for the Dispense Record entry - the information that can be captured upon the act of dispensing - in a hospital pharmacy, or a community pharmacy. This is not for a future dispense, rather a record of an actual dispense.

short.value: The business identifier(s) for the medication dispense record

definition.value: The business identifier(s) for the medication dispense session, also known as Session GUID (SGUID).

short.value: The person for which the medication is dispensed

definition.value: The person for which the medication is dispensed.

short.value: The dispenser, if known and relevant

definition.value: The dispenser, if known and relevant

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

isModifierReason.value: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

short.value: The product that was dispensed - coded or not (e.g. for magistral preparations)

definition.value: The product that was dispensed - coded or not (e.g. for magistral preparations)

short.value: The amount of product that was dispensed

definition.value: The amount of product that was dispensed

short.value: The structured dosage or text instructions for use

definition.value: The structured dosage or text instructions for use

short.value: Additional information about the dispensed item - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.

definition.value: Additional information about the dispensed item - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.

short.value: Additional information about the dispense - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.

definition.value: Additional information about the dispense - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.

The logical model for the Dispense Record entry - the information that can be captured upon the act of dispensing - in a hospital pharmacy, or a community pharmacy. This is not for a future dispense, rather a record of an actual dispense.

short.value: The business identifier(s) for the medication dispense record

definition.value: The business identifier(s) for the medication dispense session, also known as Session GUID (SGUID).

short.value: The person for which the medication is dispensed

definition.value: The person for which the medication is dispensed.

short.value: The dispenser, if known and relevant

definition.value: The dispenser, if known and relevant

short.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

short.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

short.value: The date (or date+time) when the dispense ocurred

definition.value: The date (or date+time) when the dispense ocurred

short.value: Information about a prescription related to the dispense

definition.value: Information about a prescription related to the dispense

short.value: Whether this dispense was performed against a prescription

definition.value: Whether this dispense was performed against a prescription

short.value: The prescription identification

definition.value: The prescription identification

short.value: Each product that was dispensed

definition.value: Each product that was dispensed
